questions.question: What metric balances precision and recall?
questions.explanation: F1-score is the harmonic mean of precision and recall.

questions.question: What is the ratio of true positives to all predicted positives?
questions.explanation: Precision measures the accuracy of positive predictions.

questions.question: What metric shows the ratio of true positives to all actual positives?
questions.explanation: Recall measures how many actual positives were correctly identified.

questions.question: What occurs when a model is too simple to capture patterns?
questions.explanation: Underfitting results from insufficient model complexity.

questions.question: What method combines predictions from multiple models?
questions.explanation: Ensemble learning aggregates multiple models for better performance.

questions.question: What type of regularization adds L1 penalty to the loss function?
questions.explanation: Lasso regression performs feature selection through L1 penalty.

questions.question: What type of regularization adds L2 penalty to the loss function?
questions.explanation: Ridge regression uses L2 penalty to reduce coefficient magnitudes.

questions.question: What learning paradigm uses rewards and penalties?
questions.explanation: Reinforcement learning trains agents through trial and error.

questions.question: What technique creates synthetic training examples?
questions.explanation: Data augmentation expands training data through transformations.

questions.question: What is the process of selecting important features called?
questions.explanation: Feature selection identifies the most relevant variables for modeling.
